Example: She was taken aback by the news.
They decided to abandon the project.
She was abashed by the rude comments.
The storm began to abate.
Please abbreviate the full name.
His aberrant behavior worried the staff.

Meaning: 怂恿, 支持, 教唆（犯罪）
Example: He was accused of helping to commit the crime.
The project was put into abeyance due to funding issues.
I abhor cruelty.
She has an abiding love for her family.
She decided to abnegate her previous claims.
The government decided to abolish the outdated law.
I abominate unfair treatment.
The garden abounds with flowers.
The rough surface will abrade the fabric over time.
She kept abreast of the latest news.
The editor decided to abridge the lengthy novel.
The movie was truly absorbing.
He leads an abstemious life, avoiding excess.
The concept of time is an abstraction that we often take for granted.
The theory is quite abstruse for most people.
He tends to abuse his authority.
They feared falling into the abyss.
She decided to accede to their demands.
She has a British accent.
The artwork was accentuated by the use of bright colors.
The crowd acclaimed the performer.
He received a prestigious accolade for his work.
The manager tried to accommodate the employee's request.
They reached an accord after long negotiations.
Managers are accountable for their team's performance.
The land started to accrete around the new building.
His acerbic comments offended many people.
The lemon juice has an acidic taste.
She acknowledged the gift with a smile.
The company's success reached its acme last year.
He was an acolyte to the famous priest.
She chose to acquiesce to their demands.
She has acquired excellent skills over the years.
He has an acquisitive nature and always wants more.
The jury reached an acquittal after the trial.
Their argument was filled with acrimony.
She has great acumen in business decisions.
She was diagnosed with an acute illness.
She was adamant about her decision.
The lawyer adduced new evidence during the trial.
She is an adept dancer.
She will adhere to the rules.
The two houses are adjacent to each other.
The court will adjudicate the case tomorrow.
The university offers adjunct faculty positions.
He made an adjuration to the court.
The teacher admonished the students for being late.
She decided to adorn her room with flowers.
He is an adroit negotiator.
She received a lot of adulation after her performance.
Manufacturers adulterate products to reduce costs.
The companies have an adversarial relationship.
The weather was adverse to our plans.
